text: ان هذا لرزقنا ما له من نفاد

translations.translation: This is surely Our provision never-ending.
This is Our provision for you, never to end.
Our provision (for you) will never be exhausted.
Indeed this is Our sustenance, which will never end.
(It will be said to them)! Verily, this is Our provision which will never finish.
Most surely this is Our sustenance; it shall never come to an end;
this is Our provision, unto which there is no end.'
Lo! this in truth is Our provision, which will never waste away.
Our provision for you will never be exhausted.
Verily this is Our provision: there will be no ceasing thereof.
This is Our provision, which will never be exhausted.
Truly such will be Our Bounty (to you); it will never fail;-
(It will be said to them)! Verily, this is Our Provision which will never finish;
Indeed, this is Our provision; for it there is no depletion.

[38:54] This is indeed Our provision, which will never be exhausted’, in other words, one which will never cease (this [last] sentence [mā lahu min nafādin] is a circumstantial qualifier referring to rizqunā, ‘Our provision’; or it is a second predicate of inna, ‘indeed’, meaning that it will be ‘everlasting’).
(Lo! this in truth is Our provision) this is the food and bliss We have for them, (which will never waste away) which will never cease or be interrupted.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: ثم قال سبحانه إظهاراً لكمال قدرته على الإنعام والانتقام: { إِنَّ هَـٰذَا } المذكور { لَرِزْقُنَا } المعد لخواص عبادنا، المنجذبين إلينا بانخلاعهم عن لوازم هوياتهم الباطلة، وعن مقتضيات تعيناتهم العاطلة من المأكل والمشرب والمناكح الفانية، فنستبدل لهم بدلها { مَا لَهُ مِن نَّفَادٍ } [ص: 54] أي: رزقاً معنوياً لا انقطاع له أصلاً
